content.description: Start on an undercling or some sidepulls and move up and right. There are so many good holds here, there's probably 6 different ways you could do this, but just enjoy.
content.location: Start in the middle of the south face. The downclimb is on the southwest face, and you can jump off the boulder.

content.description: Sit start with a good right hand edge and a left hand bump on the arete. From there, work along the lip using the bumps and a heel hook, eventually gain a good left hand edge, bump through a right hand sidepull to gain a better sidepull above, gain the feet on the face, and finish up the remaining jugs.
content.protection: I had two pads and two sit start pads. It worked well enough. The landing consists of rocks, but they pad well, and you never climb high from the landing.
content.location: It climbs the east section of 1014's north face.

content.description: Sit start with your choice of edge, sidepull, undercling, etc. From there, climb straight up through an assortment of features to the lip, use the edges on the slab, and a mantel to top out the problem.
content.protection: A pad will work. There is a great landing.
content.location: It climbs the center of 1014's south face.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand edge and a right hand bump. From there, pull up to the jug at the lip, continue traversing right along the lip using an assortment of jugs, and mantel on top the boulder just before its apex.
content.protection: A pad or two will work well. The landing is very good, but there is a rock near the topout.
content.location: It traverses the south lip of 1014.

content.description: Sit start with a great right hand mail-slot and a left hand diagonal edge. From there, gain a decent left hand ball-edge, follow to a right hand sidepull on the seam, then use the remaining edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad will work. There is a very good landing.
content.location: It climbs the center of 1014's north face.

content.description: Sit start on the rock matched on the arete. From there, follow the arete to the lip, and mantel onto the slab for an easy finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. It has a decent landing despite the rock it climbs over.
content.location: It climbs the south side of 1014's southwest arete.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand pinch and a right hand on the arete. From there, gain a left heel hook, work the right hand up the arete, and traverse slightly left to an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is shared with a pair of trees and a rock.
content.location: It climbs the south side of 1014's southeast arete.

content.description: Start on an undercling or an assortment of crimps and pinches in the bottom middle of the south face (the original hold we were using broke off). Move up through the great jugs into a hard crux with a one pad crimp and a huge bump into the final jug before the top out.
content.location: This is in the middle of the south face. You can actually jump off right in the middle of where you climbed, since this is mainly a traverse.

content.description:
IT climbs a nice arete feature on good stone over a decent landing.

Sit start (no cheats here, proper sit meaning your ass is the last part of your body to leave the ground) with a left hand sloping three-finger edge and a great right hand edge. From there, use a high right foot to pull off the ground, bump the right hand up to a sidepull, achieve a quasi-kneebar, bump further up the arete with the right hand, bring along the left hand to the lip, and work the remaining arete to reach an mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work. Overall, the landing is good, but there is a rock in the landing at the start that you'll want covered.
content.location: It climbs the west section of 1014's north face.

content.description: Sit start matched on the lowest hueco. From there, climb a series of slopers, edges, gastons, and sidepulls to reach the lip and an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. It has a pretty good landing except for a rock that makes it slightly uneven.
content.location:
It climbs just to the left of

Keep It Close Like Hugs

(uses some of the same holds but not the arete).
